title: Calories in a Turkey Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in sandwich turkey, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard deli turkey sandwich: 2 slices whole wheat bread, 3 oz sliced turkey breast, lettuce, tomato, 1 tbsp mayo; no cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, portion size, bread type, toppings, and preparation. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard turkey sandwich has about 350 kcal and 20 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole grain bread and double turkey

faqs.q: How many calories in a turkey sandwich?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard version with bread, turkey, veggies, and mayo.

faqs.q: What's the protein in calories in sandwich turkey?

faqs.a: Around 40 g carbs mainly from bread; opt for low-carb wraps to reduce.

faqs.q: How does sodium affect calories in sandwich turkey?
faqs.a: High sodium (~1100 mg) from deli meat and bread, but doesn't add calories directly.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower calorie turkey sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, skip mayo and add more veggies to drop to ~260 kcal.
